{{also|aus|Aus|AUs|AUS|A.U.'s|auș|AU$}} ==Aragonese== ===Noun=== {{head|an|noun plural form}} # {{plural of|an|au}} ---- ==Catalan== ===Noun=== {{head|ca|noun form}} # {{plural of|ca|au}} ---- ==Cimbrian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|cim|gmh|uz|ūʒ}}, from {{inh|cim|goh|uz|ūʒ}}, from {{inh|cim|gem-pro|*ūt}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|aus}}, {{cog|nl|uit}}, {{cog|en|out}}, {{cog|is|út}}. The sense “west” may be reinforced by or a semantic loan from {{der|cim|vec|-}}: {{m|vec|[[vago]] [[fora]] [[a]] [[Verona]]||I go west to Verona|lit=I go out to Verona}}. ===Adverb=== {{head|cim|adverb}} {{tlb|cim|7}} # [[out]], [[outwards]] #: {{uxi|cim|khéeran '''aus'''|to sweep '''out'''}} #: {{uxi|cim|'''aus''' néntalan|to get the needle '''out'''}} # [[west]], out west #: {{ux|cim|Ich ghéa '''aus''' kan Bèarn.|I'm going '''out west''' to Verona.}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|cim|bornaus}} * {{l|cim|denaus}} ===References=== * {{R:Martalar1974}} ---- ==Elfdalian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|ovd|non|hús}}, from {{inh|ovd|gem-pro|*hūsą}}. Cognate with {{cog|sv|hus}}. ===Noun=== {{ovd-noun|n}} # [[house]] =====Declension===== {{ovd-decl-blank-full|title=''aus''|stem=strong ''a''-stem|g=neuter|nsi=aus|asi=aus|dsi=ause|gsi=—|nsd=auseð|asd=auseð|dsd=ausę|gsd=—|npi=aus|api=aus|dpi=ausum|gpi=—|npd=ausę|apd=ausę|dpd=ausum(e)|gpd=—}}{{catlangname|ovd|a-stem nouns}} ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== From {{suffix|et|au|s}}. ===Adjective=== {{et-adj|ausa|ausat}} # [[honest]] ====Declension==== {{et-decl-õpik|aus|a}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|goh|ūz||out}} from {{der|de|gem-pro|*ūt}}. Compare {{cog|nl|uit}}, {{cog|en|out}}, {{cog|da|ud}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-aus.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/aʊs/}} * {{rhymes|de|aʊ̯s}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[out]] # {{lb|de|with ''[[sein]]''}} [[over]]; [[finish]]ed; [[done]]; [[up]] #: {{ux|de|Das Spiel ist '''aus'''!|t=The game is '''up'''!}} # {{lb|de|of a device}} [[off]] ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|of a device|off}} {{l|de|an}}, {{l|de|ein}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Aus}} ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition|+ dative}} # [[out of]]; [[from]] {{gloss|from the inside of something}} #: {{ux|de|Hol das Besteck '''aus''' der Schublade!|Get the cutlery '''from''' the drawer!}} # [[from]] {{gloss|a place; see usage notes below}} #: {{ux|de|Er kommt '''aus''' demselben Dorf wie ich.|He’s '''from''' the same village as I am.}} # [[of]]; made of; out of #: {{ux|de|ein Haus '''aus''' Eis|a house '''made of''' ice}} # [[for]]; out of {{gloss|because of a feeling or inner quality}} #: {{ux|de|etwas '''aus''' Freundschaft tun|t=to do something '''out of''' friendship (i.e. a sense of friendship)}} #: {{ux|de|etwas '''aus''' Feigheit unterlassen|t=to neglect something '''out of''' cowardice}} ====Usage notes==== * {{lb|de|from a place}} The normal word for “from” (when meaning something other than “out of, from the inside of”) is {{m|de|von}}. For example: {{m|de||ein Geschenk von meinen Eltern|t=a present from my parents}}. However, {{m|de||aus}} is used with words for rooms, dwellings, settlements, and territories, such as {{m|de|Haus|t=house}}, {{m|de|Garten|t=garden}}, {{m|de|Dorf|t=village}}, {{m|de|Land|t=country}}, etc., and also with geographical names that refer to such places. An exception to this rule is that {{m|de||von}} is used when both an origin and a destination are given. Individual words may also behave irregularly; so one says {{m|de||von einem Bauernhof|t=from a farm}}. Compare {{m|de|von}} for more. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|aus die Maus}} ---- ==Latvian== ===Verb=== {{head|lv|verb form}} # {{lv-inflection of|aut|3rd|s|fut|ind|v}} # {{lv-inflection of|aut|3rd|p|fut|ind|v}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|goh|ūz}}, from {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*ūt}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/æu̯s/|[æˑʊ̯s]}} ===Preposition=== {{head|lb|preposition|+ dative}} # [[from]], out of #: {{ux|lb|Hie kënnt '''aus''' Lëtzebuerg.|He comes '''from''' Luxembourg.}} # [[of]], made of #: {{ux|lb|Den Dësch ass '''aus''' Holz.|The table is '''made of''' wood.}} # out of, because of, [[for]] #: {{ux|lb|Ech hunn et '''aus''' Frustratioun gemaach.|I did it '''out of''' frustration.}} ===Adverb=== {{head|lb|adverb}} # [[over]], [[out]], [[finished]] ====Synonyms==== * {{l|lb|eriwwer}} ---- ==Old French== ===Contraction=== {{head|fro|contraction}} # {{contraction of|fro|[[a]] + [[les]]|t=to the {{g|p}}}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pdc|goh|ūz||out}} from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*ūt}}. Compare {{cog|de|aus}}, {{cog|nl|uit}}, {{cog|en|out}}, {{cog|da|ud}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|pdc|preposition}} # out of, [[from]]
